November 2023

- So excited for our two new additions to the lab: **Vinita Karki** and **Michael Ferrara**! Vinita will be creating a statewide decision support tool to inform wild turkey conservation, and Michael will be joining the WildSNaP project to investigate the responses of bird communities to native plantings under solar arrays. Check out the [People](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/People.html) tab to read their bios and the [Research](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/Research.html) tab to read about their projects.

August 2023

- [**1 MS position open in the lab!](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/Opportunities.html): Come investigate how birds are responding to native plantings under solar arrays! Fully funded, lots of field work, and opportunities to work with renewable energy, acoustic recording units, and a fantastic team of scientists!
- We're so excited that [Lindsey LaBrie](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/People.html) will be joining the Living Landscapes Lab this fall! Lindsey will be pursuing a PhD and leading research on aquatic invasive species. Can't wait!
- Congratulations to our very own [Jess Schmit](https://wilsonsociety.org/awards/student-presentation-awards/lynds-jones-prize/) for winning the 2023 Lynds Jones Prize for best poster at the 104th Annual Meeting of the Wilson Ornithological Society! King Rails all the way!
- And last, but definitely not least, congratulations to Percy Marshall for graduating with their M.S.! Thankfully, we're keeping Percy around for a bit to help design a study on invasive shrub treatments at Big Oaks NWR--and to finish publishing their amazing thesis chapters.

June 2023

* [**2 PhD positions open in the lab**](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/Opportunities.html):
  + *Wild Turkey Population Ecology*: Want to study wild turkeys and learn about Integrated Population Models and spatially varying coefficient models? Start date is spring 2024!
  + *Invasion Ecology*: Also, we have an amazing position investigating new methods for early detection of invasive plant species + impacts of invasive plant species. If you're interested in modeling, fire ecology, wildlife, and/or ecosystem services, we hope to see your application in the pool! Start date is fall 2023 or spring 2024.

November 2022

- How much does tree invasion of grasslands cost western US economies? Billions. Check out our new [Journal of Applied Ecology](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/1365-2664.14288) article for the details.

October 2022

- New technologies allow us to rapidly learn from rangeland management actions like prescribed fire, grazing, and tree removal at scales from 30m2 pixels to biomes! Check out our brand new [Journal of Environmental Management](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0301479722019326?dgcid=author) manuscript to learn more.
- We're kicking off a new research project on risk of [giant salvinia](https://www.invasivespeciesinfo.gov/aquatic/plants/giant-salvinia) invasion. See our [research tab](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/Research.html) to learn more!

August 2022

- [Ken Wilson](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/People.html) joined the Living Landscapes Lab this fall! Ken will be quantifying feral hog impacts on vegetation and ground-nesting birds in southeastern Arkansas USFWS refuges. Welcome, Ken!
- Speaking of Ken's project, check out the new project we're kickstarting this fall: [Assessing Wild Pig Impacts to Ecosystem Services: A Case Study on Diet, Density, and Space Use of Wild Pigs on the South Arkansas National Wildlife Refuge Complex](https://livinglandscapes.github.io/LivingLandscapes_Website/Research.html). This is a USFWS/USGS funded project, and we're very excited to get into the messy world of feral hogs.
